intro: Cleome palmipes, commonly known as the slender cleome, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Cleomaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, often showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 to 2 meters. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture, and its flowers are usually yellow or white, arranged in clusters. Cleome palmipes is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
